intro: Ceropegia circinata, commonly known as the silver leaf ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale green, often with a distinctive hood-like structure. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is adapted to store water in its thick leaves and stems. Ceropegia circinata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in low-water conditions.
